title: Windows 11 browser change: Europe applauds, outrage everywhere else
description: Microsoft will soon allow users in the European Union, as well as from Iceland, Liechtenstein, and Norway, to once again open all links in Windows using their default web browser rather than forcing the use of Microsoft Edge. [...]

title: Apple opens 2024 applications to get ‘security research’ iPhones
description: Apple announced today that iOS security researchers can now apply for a Security Research Device (SRD) by the end of October. [...]

title: WordPress migration add-on flaw could lead to data breaches
description: All-in-One WP Migration, a popular data migration plugin for WordPress sites that has 5 million active installations, suffers from unauthenticated access token manipulation that could allow attackers to access sensitive site information. [...]

title: Hacking campaign bruteforces Cisco VPNs to breach networks
description: Hackers are targeting Cisco Adaptive Security Appliance (ASA) SSL VPNs in credential stuffing and brute-force attacks that take advantage of lapses in security defenses, such as not enforcing multi-factor authentication (MFA). [...]

title: VMware Aria vulnerable to critical SSH authentication bypass flaw
description: VMware Aria Operations for Networks (formerly vRealize Network Insight) is vulnerable to a critical severity authentication bypass flaw that could allow remote attackers to bypass SSH authentication and access private endpoints. [...]

title: Trojanized Signal and Telegram apps on Google Play delivered spyware
description: Trojanized Signal and Telegram apps containing the BadBazaar spyware were uploaded onto Google Play and Samsung Galaxy Store by a Chinese APT hacking group known as GREF. [...]
